ygData.subject: Re: New patch "features"
ygData.msgSnippet: ... Hey!  I was complaining about them taking away surfing well before they actually did it!  They kept saying they were going to fix it, and I ve been
ygData.messageBody:
"(Paul D Richardson)" wrote:

> From: ("Paul D Richardson") <Richardson.Paul@...>
> ...
> I noticed that even though Verant has finally given bards something we've
> really wanted (meditate), that I got in this morning to a full inbox of people
> griping about the fact that we don't "surf" anymore. Boo hoo hoo. It seems
> some people aren't happy unless they have something to complain about.

Hey! I was complaining about them taking away surfing well before they actually did it! They kept saying
they were going to "fix" it, and I've been feedbacking it for a month saying I didn't want it to happen.
So I'm allowed! For those who care, don't get your hopes up that they'll take it out. For them to go
through all the effort to fix it in the first place suggests that they really think that this graphic is a
lot better. No accounting for taste, is there?

Meditation is very cool, btw. Not so much for the death part, since it usually takes awhile for a rez
anyway, but more for the ability to switch songs during (and in between) combat. In Sol B, if I wanted to
change my song list, and started to mem a new song just after one fight was done, we were often halfway
through the next fight before I could finish a single song remem. That's going to be a lot better now.

Kenross Cantoforjado, 40 songs, Innoruuk
